questions.question_en: Why do prices go up over time?
questions.question_zh: 为什么物价会随着时间上涨？
explanations_en: Wrong. While stores do want profit, competition usually prevents them from just raising prices freely. The real cause is that each dollar becomes less valuable over time.

Correct! This is called inflation. When governments print more money, each dollar becomes less valuable. With more money chasing the same goods, prices rise. A small amount of inflation is normal and healthy. But too much inflation means your money buys less over time. That's why $1 today buys less than in 1950!
Wrong. While quality improvements can affect some prices, this doesn't explain the general upward trend of all prices over time, including basic commodities.
Wrong. Demand fluctuates for different products and doesn't always rise. The consistent upward pressure on all prices comes from the increasing money supply reducing each dollar's value.
explanations_zh: 错啦！虽然商店确实想多赚钱，但市场竞争通常会阻止它们随意涨价。真正的原因是，随着时间的推移，每一块钱的购买力会逐渐下降。
对啦！这就是通货膨胀。当政府印更多钱时，每一块钱的购买力就变弱了。更多的钱追逐同样的商品，物价自然上涨。适度的通胀是正常且健康的，但通胀太高就意味着你的钱越来越不值钱。所以现在的一块钱能买到的东西比1950年少多啦！
错啦！虽然质量提升会影响某些商品的价格，但这并不能解释所有物价（包括基本商品）长期普遍上涨的趋势。
错啦！不同商品的需求会有波动，并不总是上升。所有物价持续上涨的压力主要来自货币供应增加导致每一块钱的购买力下降。

questions.question_zh: 股票价格为什么会变动？
explanations_en: Wrong. While algorithms do participate in trading, they're not random. They follow rules based on market data. Stock prices are ultimately determined by what buyers and sellers agree to pay.

Correct! Stock prices change based on supply and demand. When more people want to buy a stock, the price goes up. When more want to sell, it goes down. Investors buy or sell based on company performance, news, and future expectations. It's like an auction happening all day long!
Wrong. Companies don't set their own stock prices after the initial public offering. The market determines prices through buying and selling activity.
Wrong. In free markets, governments don't set stock prices. Prices are determined by buyers and sellers trading on exchanges.
explanations_zh: 错误。虽然算法参与交易，但它们并非随机运作，而是基于市场数据遵循规则。股票价格最终由买卖双方达成的协议决定。
正确！股票价格变动基于供需关系。想买股票的人多，价格就上涨；想卖的人多，价格就下跌。投资者根据公司业绩、新闻和未来预期买卖，就像全天候的拍卖会！
错误。公司在首次公开募股后不会自行设定股价，价格由市场通过买卖活动决定。
错误。在自由市场中，政府不设定股票价格，价格由交易市场上的买卖双方决定。

questions.question_zh: 银行为什么要付利息给我们呢？
explanations_en: Wrong. While banking is regulated, laws don't require banks to pay interest. Banks pay interest as a business strategy to attract deposits.

Correct! Banks pay interest to attract your deposits. They then lend that money to others at higher interest rates. The difference is their profit. For example, they might pay you 2% but charge borrowers 6%. You get paid for letting them use your money, they profit from the spread!
Wrong. While customer loyalty matters, interest is not a reward program. It's a fundamental part of banking business model - paying for deposits to relend at higher rates.
Wrong. Governments don't give banks money to pay interest. Banks earn money from the interest rate spread between what they pay depositors and charge borrowers.
explanations_zh: 错啦！虽然银行业有监管，但法律并不强制银行付利息。银行付利息是商业策略，用来吸引大家存钱。
答对啦！银行付利息是为了吸引你的存款，然后把钱以更高利息借给别人。差价就是银行的利润。比如付你2%利息，却收借款人6%，你让银行用钱，银行赚差价！
不对哦。客户忠诚度确实重要，但利息不是奖励计划。这是银行业务的核心——付钱获得存款，再以更高利率放贷赚钱。
错啦。政府不会给银行钱来付利息。银行赚钱靠的是存款利率和贷款利率之间的差价。

questions.question_en: Why do countries trade with each other?
questions.question_zh: 为什么国家之间要互相贸易呢？
explanations_en: Wrong. While trade can improve relations, that's not the economic reason. Countries trade because it's more efficient than making everything themselves.

Correct! This is called comparative advantage. Each country focuses on what it does best, then trades with others. Japan makes cars efficiently, Brazil grows coffee well, Saudi Arabia has oil. By specializing and trading, everyone gets more goods at lower cost than making everything alone!
Wrong. Moving goods long distance is a cost of trade, not the reason for it. Countries trade because specialization makes production more efficient overall.
Wrong. While trade does create jobs in shipping and logistics, this is a side effect. The main reason is that specialization allows countries to produce more efficiently.
explanations_zh: 错啦！虽然贸易能改善关系，但这可不是经济原因。国家贸易是因为比自给自足更高效哦。
对啦！这叫比较优势。每个国家专注做自己最擅长的，然后互相交换。比如日本高效造车，巴西种咖啡棒，沙特有石油。通过专业化和贸易，大家都能用更低成本获得更多商品，比单干强多啦！
错啦！长途运输是贸易的成本，不是原因。国家贸易是因为专业化让整体生产更高效。
错啦！贸易确实能创造航运和物流工作，但这是附带效果。主要原因还是专业化让各国生产更高效。

choices_zh: 天生就是最有用的金属
所有电子产品都离不开它
explanations_en: Wrong. Gold is not the most useful metal. Iron and copper are far more useful in daily life. Gold's value comes from different factors.

Correct! Gold is valuable because it's rare, doesn't corrode, and societies agreed to value it for thousands of years. It has some uses in jewelry and electronics, but its high price is mainly because people believe it's valuable and want to own it. This is called market value!
Wrong. While gold is used in some electronics due to good conductivity, it's not required for all devices. Many alternatives exist. Gold's high price is not justified by its industrial uses alone.
Wrong. Gold has no magical properties. Its value is purely based on human psychology, cultural tradition, scarcity, and its physical properties like not rusting.
explanations_zh: 错啦！黄金可不是最有用的金属。日常生活中，铁和铜的用处大多了。黄金的价值来自其他原因哦。
答对啦！黄金值钱是因为它稀有、不会生锈，而且几千年来人类社会都认可它的价值。虽然它能做首饰和电子元件，但高价主要是因为大家都觉得它珍贵想拥有——这就是市场价值！
不对哦。黄金确实因导电性好用于某些电子产品，但并非所有设备都需要它。替代材料多得很，光靠工业用途可撑不起它的天价。
错错错！黄金根本没有魔法属性。它的价值纯粹源于人类心理、文化传统、稀缺性，以及不锈蚀等物理特性。

explanations_en: Wrong. Advertising is not legally required (except for certain disclosures). Companies choose to advertise as a business strategy to boost sales.

Correct! Companies advertise to make people aware of their products and convince them to buy. Even a great product won't sell if nobody knows it exists. Advertising creates demand, builds brand loyalty, and tells customers why their product is better than competitors. The money spent often returns as increased sales!
Wrong. While advertising does fund media, that's not why companies do it. They advertise to promote their own products and increase their own sales.
Wrong. Companies don't advertise to help TV stations fill time. They pay for ad slots because it's an effective way to reach potential customers and increase their sales.
explanations_zh: 错！广告并非法律强制要求（除特定信息披露外）。公司打广告是商业策略，旨在提升销量。
对！公司打广告是为了让更多人了解产品并说服他们购买。再好的产品如果无人知晓也卖不出去。广告能创造需求、培养品牌忠诚度，并告诉顾客为什么自家产品更胜一筹。投入的广告费常能带来销量增长！
错！虽然广告确实资助了媒体，但这并非公司的初衷。他们打广告是为了推广自家产品、提高自身销量。
错！公司打广告可不是为了帮电视台填时间。他们购买广告位是因为这是触达潜在客户、提升销量的有效方式。

questions.question_en: Why do sales and discounts work?
questions.question_zh: 为什么打折促销总能吸引我们买买买？
choices_zh: 心理作用：感觉捡到便宜
explanations_en: Correct! Discounts trigger psychological responses. People feel they're getting a deal and fear missing out. A $100 item marked down to $70 feels like saving $30, even if you weren't planning to buy it. Stores often raise prices first, then discount. The urgency and perceived value drive purchases!
Wrong. Production costs don't suddenly drop during sales. Stores often build the discount into their pricing strategy from the start, or use sales to move excess inventory.
Wrong. Stores don't run sales to lose money. They use strategic pricing to increase total revenue by attracting more customers, clearing inventory, or competing with rivals.
Wrong. Governments don't require sales or discounts. Stores choose to offer them as a marketing strategy to increase customer traffic and sales volume.
explanations_zh: 正确！打折会触发心理效应——人们觉得捡到便宜，还怕错过机会。比如原价100元的东西打到70元，就算本来没想买，也会觉得省了30元。商家常先提价再打折，利用紧迫感和超值感刺激消费！
错误。商品生产成本不会在促销时突然降低。商家通常从一开始就把折扣算进定价策略，或是用促销清空积压库存。
错误。商家不会做亏本买卖。他们用策略性定价吸引更多顾客、清理库存或应对竞争，最终提升总收益。
错误。政府从不强制要求打折。这是商家自发的营销手段，用来增加客流量和销量。

questions.question_en: Why do countries use different currencies?
questions.question_zh: 为什么各国要用不同的货币呢？
explanations_en: Wrong. Currency design is not the issue. Countries could agree on designs if they wanted. The real reason is about economic control and sovereignty.

Correct! Each country wants to control its own monetary policy. By having their own currency, they can adjust interest rates, print money when needed, and respond to their specific economic conditions. The Euro shows both benefits (easier trade) and drawbacks (less individual control) of shared currency!
Wrong. Different currencies don't prevent counterfeiting - each currency faces that problem. Countries maintain separate currencies primarily for economic independence and policy control.
Wrong. While tradition and national identity play a role, the main reason is practical economic control. Countries need the ability to manage their money supply and interest rates independently.
explanations_zh: 错啦！货币设计根本不是关键，真想统一图案各国也能商量。真正原因是经济自主权和掌控力。
对头！每个国家都想自己说了算。有了专属货币，就能灵活调整利率、按需印钞，应对自家经济状况。欧元区就是活例子——共用货币方便贸易，但各国自主权也受限了！
错！不同货币防不了假币，每种货币都得面对这个问题。各国坚持独立货币，主要是为了经济独立和政策自主。
错！虽然传统和民族情感有点影响，但主因是实打实的经济掌控需求——国家必须能独立调节货币供应和利率。
